_description: John Lydgate, Exposition of the Pater Noster — forty-two 8-line stanzas, including envoy

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
A twyxe dred and tremblyng reuerencea stoned I am for fer dar nat
                    be hold…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…that I may ffynde supportacyounBy goddes ffavour to correcte
                    of ther grace
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 60-71.

CamJes56.First Lines:
[A]twix drede and tremblyng ReuerenceAstonyd I am for fere dar nat
                    beholde…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…That I may fynde supportacionBy goodly fauoure to corret of
                    þeire grace
CamJes56.Editions:
Mahir,  Otto,
                        ed.  
             Eine religiöse Gedichte John Lydgates.
         Oberviechtach: Adolf Mahir, 1910: 1-14.

BLHar2255.First Lines:
Atwixe dreed and tremblyng reuerenceAstonyd I am for feer dar not
                    beholde…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…That I may fynde SupportaciounBy goodly favour to correcte of
                    ther grace
BLHar2255.Attributed Author: Explicit quod Iohn lydgate (f. 39v, in margin)
